solution_line_template: If the house has twice the number of large ones as medium ones then the house has {multiplier_large_lights}*{medium_lights} = <<{multiplier_large_lights}*{medium_lights}={num_large_lights}>>{num_large_lights} large ceiling lights

Similarly, if it has {small_lights_more_than_medium} more small ones than the {medium_lights} medium ones then it has {small_lights_more_than_medium}+{medium_lights} = <<{small_lights_more_than_medium}+{medium_lights}={num_small_lights}>>{num_small_lights} small ceiling lights

If one small ceiling light requires {bulbs_per_small_light} bulb then {num_small_lights} small ones will require {bulbs_per_small_light}*{num_small_lights} = <<{bulbs_per_small_light}*{num_small_lights}={bulbs_for_small_lights}>>{bulbs_for_small_lights} bulbs

If one medium ceiling light requires {bulbs_per_medium_light} bulbs then {medium_lights} medium ones will require {bulbs_per_medium_light}*{medium_lights} = <<{bulbs_per_medium_light}*{medium_lights}={bulbs_for_medium_lights}>>{bulbs_for_medium_lights} bulbs

If one large ceiling light requires {bulbs_per_large_light} bulbs then {num_large_lights} medium ones will require {bulbs_per_large_light}*{num_large_lights} = <<{bulbs_per_large_light}*{num_large_lights}={bulbs_for_large_lights}>>{bulbs_for_large_lights} bulbs

Therefore the house will require {bulbs_for_small_lights} bulbs for the small ones + {bulbs_for_medium_lights} bulbs for the medium ones + {bulbs_for_large_lights} bulbs for the large ones, for a total of {bulbs_for_small_lights}+{bulbs_for_medium_lights}+{bulbs_for_large_lights}=<<{bulbs_for_small_lights}+{bulbs_for_medium_lights}+{bulbs_for_large_lights}={total_bulbs}>>{total_bulbs}
